articles.author: Sibusiso Mjikeliso
articles.title: Ex-Proteas opener Hudson recalls Warne sledging battles: 'The nicest guy off the field'
articles.description: Andrew Hudson paid tribute to the "huge competitor", Shane Warne, who died of natural causes in Thailand last Friday, aged 52. Hudson has a unique history with late great Aussie cricketer, who infamously sledged him in Johannesburg in 1994.
articles.content:
• Andrew Hudson has a unique history with late great Aussie cricketer Shane Warne, who infamously sledged him in Johannesburg in 1994.
  • Warne delivered one of his most vicious "send-offs… [+3768 chars]

articles.author: Mazoe Ford
articles.title: Shane Warne: Thai police say woman allowed into ambulance with Australian cricketer's body did nothing against the law
articles.description: Footage captured by the ABC on the ferry from Koh Samui exposes a startling lack of security surrounding the transportation of Shane Warne's body, but police say the woman who took flowers to the ambulance did not do anything against the law.
articles.content: Thai police have questioned a German woman who got into the back of the ambulance transporting the body of Australian cricket legend Shane Warne from the island of Koh Samui, but say she did not do a… [+4904 chars]

articles.author: BBC News
articles.title: Shane Warne: Australian cricket legend died from natural causes - police
articles.description: Thai police say there's no sign of foul play in the cricketer's death while on holiday on Koh Samui.
articles.content:
Image caption, Warne had been on holiday on Koh Samui when he died of a suspected heart attack

articles.title: What we learned from watching the 1992 World Cup final in full again | ESPNcricinfo.com
articles.description: Wides, lbw calls, swing - plenty of things were different in white-ball cricket back then | ESPNcricinfo.com
articles.content: Last week, we at ESPNcricinfo did something we have been thinking of doing for eight years now: pretend-live ball-by-ball commentary for a classic cricket match. We knew the result, yes, but we tried… [+6823 chars]
